options.conflictTitle: When a file with the same name already exists
options.conflictNote: ‚ö†Ô∏è Important: These options only check the file NAME, not whether the file is complete. If a previous copy was interrupted (e.g., a 500GB file stopped at 250GB), the incomplete file still 'exists' and may be skipped!
options.replaceDifferentDesc: üìä Compares BOTH size AND date. Example: Your 500GB video got interrupted at 250GB ‚Äî the file sizes won't match. ‚úÖ This will detect it and copy the complete file. ‚úÖ Also updates files you've edited. ‚úÖ Skips files that are already complete. Best for: Almost everyone! This catches incomplete files AND updates changed files.
options.replaceSmartLabel: Only copy newer files (faster, less safe)
options.replaceSmartDesc: üìÖ Compares dates only. Example: You edited 'report.docx' yesterday. The backup drive has an older version from last week. ‚úÖ This will update it. ‚ùå BUT if your copy was interrupted (file shows 250GB instead of 500GB), it will NOT fix it because the date looks the same. Best for: Regular backups where you trust previous copies completed successfully.
options.replaceAllDesc: üîÑ Always copies, no questions asked. Example: Your 500GB video got interrupted at 250GB. ‚úÖ This will copy the full file again. ‚ùå Slower because it copies files that might already be complete. Best for: When a previous backup failed or was interrupted. When you're not sure if files are complete.
options.skipDesc: ‚è≠Ô∏è If a file exists, skip it completely. Example: You're adding NEW photos to a backup drive that already has older photos. ‚úÖ Fast - only copies what's missing. ‚ùå DANGER: If 'vacation.mp4' exists but is corrupted or incomplete, it will NOT be fixed. Best for: Adding new files when you're 100% certain existing files are complete.
options.askDesc: ü§î Shows a popup for every conflict. You choose what to do with each file. ‚úÖ Full control over every decision. ‚ùå Can be tedious with many files. Best for: Mixed situations where some files should be replaced and others shouldn't.
options.integrityNote: A "checksum" is like a fingerprint for your file. If even 1 byte is different, the fingerprint changes completely.
options.verifyOffDesc: Trust that the copy worked. This is fine for most local copies.
options.verifyDuringDesc: Calculate fingerprints during the copy. Slightly slower but catches errors immediately.
options.verifyAfterDesc: After everything is copied, go back and check each file. Good for critical data.
options.verifyBothDesc: Verify during AND after. Slowest but gives the highest confidence your files are perfect.
options.autoRepairDesc: If verification finds a problem, automatically try copying that file again.
options.deleteOrphansDesc: Delete files at destination that don't exist in source. ‚ö†Ô∏è Be careful: this removes files!
options.preserveDesc: Copy who can read/write each file. Important for shared drives and servers.
options.symlinkDesc: When a file is actually a shortcut to another location, copy the real file instead of the shortcut.
options.dryRunDesc: See exactly what would be copied or deleted, without making any changes. Great for testing.
options.bandwidthDesc: Limit how fast files are copied to avoid slowing down other network activity.
options.shutdownLabel: Turn off my Mac when done
options.shutdownDesc: After all files are successfully copied, shut down the computer. Useful for overnight transfers.

verification.title: Some files need your attention
verification.subtitle: We tried to copy these files, but something went wrong. Don't worry, your original files are safe!

checksumMismatch.simple: The copy doesn't match the original
checksumMismatch.detail: The file was copied, but something changed during the process. This can happen if your computer was busy or the disk is having issues.
checksumMismatch.action: Click "Try again" to copy it fresh. If it keeps happening, try restarting your computer.

fileMissing.detail: We couldn't find this file anymore. Maybe it was moved or deleted by another program.
fileMissing.action: Check if the file still exists in the original location. If you moved it, you'll need to add it again.

permissionDenied.detail: Your Mac is protecting this location. RSync needs special permission to copy files here.
permissionDenied.action: Go to Settings ‚Üí Permissions and make sure RSync has "Full Disk Access" turned on.

diskFull.detail: The destination disk is full. There's no room left to save this file.
diskFull.action: Free up some space on the destination disk by deleting files you don't need, then try again.

sourceModified.detail: Another program was writing to this file during the copy. The copied version may be incomplete or corrupted.
sourceModified.action: Wait for the file to stop changing (close any apps using it), then try again. If this is a log file or database, consider excluding it from sync.

unknown.detail: We're not sure exactly what went wrong, but we couldn't complete the copy.
unknown.action: Try again. If it still doesn't work, restart RSync and try once more.
